item.title: Smashing animal water tub #2 | 16th August 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On August 16, 2024, at approximately 13:18: The occupant of flat 14 returned from a local shop. He stared...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On August 16, 2024, at approximately 13:18:

  1. The occupant of flat 14 returned from a local shop.
  2. He stared at our flat’s entryway while passing.
  3. He then returned and focused on our door for about 10 seconds.
  4. The individual forcefully kicked and smashed a water dish we had placed for local animals (2nd time today).
  5. Finally, he returned to his flat, making excessive noise.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On August 16, 2024 at approximately 13:18the the occupant of flat 14 was observed returning from a local shop. Upon approach, the he directed his gaze towards our flat’s entryway while passing. Subsequently, the person returned to the vicinity of our doorway, maintaining visual focus on our door for an estimated duration of 10 seconds. Following this, the individual proceeded to forcefully smash a recently placed water receptacle by kicking it, which had been positioned for the purpose of providing hydration to local animals. The person then returned to their flat, producing an excessive and disruptive level of noise.

Video:

Photos:

item.title: Throwing things at door, Smashing animal water tub | 16th August 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On August 16, 2024, at 09:58 AM: The tenant of flat 14 was seen walking his dog near the...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: On August 16, 2024, at 09:58 AM:

  1. The tenant of flat 14 was seen walking his dog near the residence, frequently looking at the entrance.
  2. After briefly returning to his door, he threw a metallic object at our door, disturbing our cats to awakening us.
  3. About 20 seconds later, he approached our front door, mumbling to himself.
  4. He then deliberately damaged a water container for neighborhood pets before returning to his flat.

The previous night:

  1. Loud noises and excessive shouting were heard from upstairs.
  2. The tenant was overheard having a long, loud phone conversation.
  3. The call appeared to be an attempt to obtain illegal substances, which seems to be a daily occurrence.
  4. His attempt was unsuccessful, possibly due to depleted supply from his mass previous purchases.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On August 16, 2024 at approximately 09:58AM, security camera footage captured the following incident involving the tenant of flat 14: The individual was observed walking his dog in the vicinity of our residence, frequently glancing towards our entrance. After briefly returning to his unit, the tenant reappeared, and his shadow was visible on the ground. At this point, the footage shows him retrieving a metallic object and propelling it at our door, causing distress to our cats (which woke us up). Subsequently, the tenant returned his dog to his flat. Approximately 20 seconds later, he approached our front door directly, appearing to speak to himself. Upon reaching our doorstep, he directed his attention to a water receptacle we maintain for the benefit of neighborhood pets. The tenant then deliberately damaged this container, fracturing it into two pieces, before retreating to his own residence.

The previous night audible disturbances emanated from upstairs. The tenant was overheard engaging in a loud, prolonged telephone conversation. Based on the content of this call, it appeared that the individual was attempting to procure illicit substances, an activity that has been observed to occur on a daily basis. On this particular occasion, the tenant’s efforts seemed to be unsuccessful, potentially due to excessive prior purchases depleting the available supply from his regular source.

Video:

Photos:

item.title: sticking finger up at camera whilst walking past | 15th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 15th of June, 2024, the individual residing in flat number 14 was observed via our security footage...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 15th of June, 2024, the individual residing in flat number 14 was observed via our security footage making an offensive gesture with his middle finger directed at the camera while passing by our window. Additionally, towards the conclusion of the video clip, he is seen making a similar gesture towards the bedroom window, where a non-functional camera is installed.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS for Joe at WDH to see

Impact:
Annoying

Details:
At approximately 4:48 PM, the resident of number 14 proceeded to take his dog outside for its 20 second a day walk to the adjacent grassy area. Subsequent to re-entering his flat with the dog, he then navigated towards the side of the flat’s. Upon passing by the window, he abruptly turned back and gestured inappropriately towards the surveillance cameras. Attached is a video recording captured by our living room security camera. It should be noted that another camera, located in our bedroom, was also subjected to the offensive gesture; although currently non-operational, its presence is discernible in the latter part of the attached video.

Video: basic Microsoft webcam in living room window

Photos:

item.title: Outside light punched, pacing In dark pretending to be on phone to take photos | 8th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number 14 was suspected of searching for surveillance cameras, as evidenced by his behavior with his dog and previous incidents involving his associates. Despite considering contacting WDHâ€™s out-of-hours service, the intermittent cessation of noise led us to refrain. Later, the tenant exhibited suspicious behavior outside, including feigned phone conversations and observable flashes from his phone camera, suggesting covert recording activities. At 3:20 AM, he approached the door, likely recording, and at 3:42 AM, he struck an exterior light fixture. These actions are consistent with past observations of drug-related transactions and usage, specifically cocaine, as well as withdrawal symptoms during periods without narcotics.
Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused stress that negatively affects Lucy’s heart condition’s.

Key Points:
Stressed, Annoying, logged as “endangerment”,

Details:
On the 8th of June, 2024, at approximately 1:30 AM, we were disturbed by loud noises resembling hammering, which interrupted our sleep and prompted us to consider contacting the out-of-hours service provided by WDH. However, the noise ceased intermittently, leading us to believe it would stop like normal, rendering a service call potentially unnecessary. Subsequently, just before 2:00 AM, we observed the individual from flat number 14 descending the stairs with considerable force, ostensibly to walk his dog. We have reasons to suspect that his true intention was to search for surveillance equipment, a behavior we have witnessed on multiple occasions. This suspicion is supported by the fact that he was observed pacing back and forth and interrupting the dogâ€™s natural behavior, as captured in the accompanying video at the 44-second mark.

Our previous incident report includes footage of an associate of the tenant from flat number 14 attempting to open our door while the tenant himself stood by his own door, presumably to ascertain the presence of a camera monitoring that area.

Thirty minutes later, at 2:31 AM, the tenant returned outdoors without his dog and loitered for several minutes. This activity is highlighted in the video with a motion-tracing arrow. During this time, he appeared to engage in a phone conversation, but the intermittent flashes from his phone camera, particularly when he moved through shadowed areas, suggest otherwise. These flashes are evident in the video at 1:30 and again at 2:24.

At 3:20 into the video, the tenant approaches the door, continuing the pretense of a phone conversation, likely with the intent of recording video footage. We believe this was done to scrutinize the area for cameras with greater detail at a later time. Shortly thereafter, he is seen striking the exterior light fixture, an act clearly visible in the video at 3:42.

This incident appears to be another instance of erratic behavior, which we have observed to correlate with periods when the tenant lacks narcotics. Such behavior includes restlessness and involuntary movements, symptomatic of withdrawal from potent drugs.

While we cannot definitively identify the substance involved, there is a strong likelihood that it is cocaine, based on repeated observations of the tenant engaging in transactions involving white powders at his doorstep. This has been corroborated by several neighbors and is further evidenced by frequent visits to vehicles and motorcycles, as well as audible indications of drug use, including chopping sounds, snorting, and exclamations, occurring sporadically throughout the day and night.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole)
Â Â Â Â  â“˜ This video utilizes media codecs that are incompatible with Firefox and requires a browser based on Chrome to play.

â“˜ The video lacks audio as it is streamed via YouTube directly to a private profile. This approach not only leverages YouTubeâ€™s unlimited storage capacity but also ensures access to the footage in the event the recording device is compromised. Nonetheless, due to YouTubeâ€™s copyright policies, the audio was removed after detecting copyrighted content from a television program in the background.
Click here to enlarge.

 

Photos: (small selection of screenshots taken from video)

item.title: Drain pipe pulled down | 1st April 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 1st of April, 2024, an abrupt and considerable disturbance in the form of a loud noise abruptly...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 1st of April, 2024, an abrupt and considerable disturbance in the form of a loud noise abruptly interrupted our sleep. This was immediately followed by the sound of someone hastening up the staircase. A review of our CCTV system footage indicated that the individual residing in flat number 14 had passed by our door. Within a brief interval of approximately one minute, the loud noise was once again detected, after which the same individual was observed returning at a quickened pace and ascending the stairs.
Upon the morning of the next day, the cause of the disturbance became apparent: a damaged drainpipe was discovered in a state of disarray upon the ground, evidently the source of the noise from the previous night.

Reported To:
WDH | Police

Impact:
Annoying he keeps trashing things and WDH haven’t just evicted him by now. (and later employed him a few months later despite all this!)
Logged with council (who are going to repair it who have now repaired it ) Also logged with police.

Key Points:
Stressed, Had to get WDH to Repair,

Details:
We were abruptly awakened by a substantial noise, which was discernible even through the use of silicone earplugs. This was swiftly succeeded by the sound of an individual ascending the staircase. Upon reviewing our doorâ€™s CCTV footage, it was observed that the resident of flat number 14 had traversed past our foor. Approximately one minute subsequent to their passage, the aforementioned noise was audible, followed by the individualâ€™s hastened return and subsequent ascent of the stairs.

An inspection of the windows yielded no discernible cause for the disturbance, prompting our return to repose. However, the following morning, en route to our shopping endeavors, we encountered the source of the previous nightâ€™s disruption: a drainpipe, now in a state of disrepair, lay upon the ground with its fixtures severely damaged and scattered.

We have documented the condition of the drainpipe through photographs and have appended these to our incident report. Additionally, we have provided a recording from our doorâ€™s CCTV system, which captures the individualâ€™s movements both prior to and following the incident.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)


Photos: Click to enlarge.

item.title: Attacked whilst having a cig outside | 25th September 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 25th of September, 2023, I was subjected to an unprovoked assault while smoking outside my residence. At...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 25th of September, 2023, I was subjected to an unprovoked assault while smoking outside my residence. At that time, we had not anticipated the need for surveillance equipment due to our amicable relations with the surrounding residents and the absence of any prior hostilities. Regrettably, the only available footage captures the aftermath of the incident, including the assailantâ€™s aggressive attempts to gain entry into our residence prior to the arrival of law enforcement.

Assault Summery:
The presumed catalyst for the assailantâ€™s behavior may be attributed to substance depletion, likely cocaine, which possibly exacerbated his already erratic conduct. This incident followed our formal complaint regarding excessive noise emanating from his residenceâ€”a matter we had previously addressed through civil discourse to no avail, as corroborated by WDH and the environmental health agencyâ€™s unsuccessful attempts at communication.

Reason for assault:
We think he had run out of cocaine, and was acting childish because we had recently reported him for making too much noise (which we attempted to speak with him about like polite adults, as have WDH and the environmental health agency to no avail because he simply ignores everyone.)

Reported To:
The altercation was promptly reported to both WDH and the police. The responding officers apprehended the assailant; however, he was released subsequent to providing a counterstatement alleging self-defense. Upon his return, he inflicted damage to the exterior wall of our residence. The incident was recorded by WDH, but the response from the assigned representative, Richard, was unsatisfactory, as he displayed a lack of interest in resolving our concerns and failed to include us in the out-of-hours service list at the time it was needed. This oversight resulted in missed opportunities for intervention. Since then, the assailant has engaged in deliberate noise disturbances at irregular intervals, complicating the process for WDH representatives to witness the infractions.

Impact:
The incident necessitated immediate medical attention for Michael at the Accident and Emergency department due to significant facial swelling and an ocular injury, which impaired his vision for an extended period exceeding two months. The assault resulted in a diagnosed concussion, facial contusions, and an eye trauma. The repercussions extended beyond physical injuries, inducing considerable psychological distress and apprehension. The fear instigated by the event led to a marked reduction in our willingness to leave the residence, a cessation of previous habits such as smoking outside, and a reluctance to venture out after dark. The presence of the assailant in the vicinity continues to be a source of anxiety, with concerns over potential recurrence of such violence. For enhanced security, we have altered our sleeping arrangements, opting to stay in the living room, which is strategically located closer to the entrance. Concerns also persist regarding the integrity of the propertyâ€™s entrance, following the assailantâ€™s repeated attempts to compromise it. Despite attempts to address the situation through written communication, there has been a lack of response and no discernible resolution.

Key Points:
The assault has had lasting effects, with persistent discomfort in my eye, which remains sensitive to touch. The assailant explicitly threatened our lives, and the physical aggression was directed solely at me, with the potential for further harm had we not retreated indoors. Medical professionals at the Accident and Emergency department confirmed the severity of the concussion. There were false allegations made to the police by the assailant, claiming I was the instigator. Following his release, he engaged in further destructive behavior, damaging the wall adjacent to our residence, which is believed to be part of multiple attempts to gain unauthorized entry.

Details:
while I was smoking outside my residence and concurrently relocating refuse that had been improperly deposited at our doorstep, I was approached in an aggressive manner by the occupant of 14 Pine Close. This individual vociferously questioned my actions with profanity and proceeded to physically assault me without provocation. In self-defense, I attempted to disengage by obstructing his vision, pulling his jacket over his face, but he escalated the altercation by forcibly throwing me to the ground, inserting his finger into my ocular cavity, and continuing to strike me. This assault induced a sensation of unconsciousness, and had it not been for the intervention of my partner, who requires my care due to her disabilities, I believe the assailant could have caused permanent blindness or further harm.

We managed to retreat to the safety of our residence and promptly alerted the authorities. Meanwhile, the assailant continued his violent behavior, causing damage to the propertyâ€™s entrance, necessitating repairs by WDH. Upon the arrival of law enforcement, the assailant was detained, and I was sent to the Accident and Emergency department for medical evaluation. Despite the severity of my injuries, which included facial swelling, impaired vision, and necessitated the consumption of analgesics for an extended period, the assailant was only subjected to a brief incarceration. Furthermore, upon his release, he immediately resumed his destructive actions by damaging the wall adjacent to our doorway, which again required repair services provided by WDH.

Video: (Can’t find the video without text overlay, this one has text descriptions)


Photos: Click to enlarge.

item.title: Attempted brake in, criminal Damage and harassment | 23rd June 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on the 23rd June 2023 we were woken up by extremely loud banging, knocking things over with vibrations all...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
on the 23rd June 2023 we were woken up by extremely loud banging, knocking things over with vibrations all over the place, being very angry about all the banging and out stuff falling over we banged back, just two bangs on the ceiling, then he came stomping down stairs and started punching the door, threatening us both, smashing up our garden chairs and damaging the house door (again),

Reported To:
Police (111)

Impact:
This caused a lot of stressed for both of us. Made us nervous to go outside due to the threats to both of us. Caused a lot of worry, when people would come to door when it was late/dark outside.

Key Points:
Very Stressed, Lucy has stress chest pain, Property destroyed,

Details:
We were woken up over and over that night by banging that was getting louder, eventually it was so loud things were falling over all over the place, the kitchen clock fell off the wall, a Microsoft surface tablet fell over and got a cracked screen, animals were scared, Lucy’s chest was hurting from stress. so we banged back just two times on the ceiling, then he came stomping down stairs shouting and screaming, smashing up our chairs threatening to murder us and attack us, we had to hold the door shut because the locks on the door were already damaged from his previous banging at the door.
He then went back upstairs and stopped around for hours and played loud music whilst we were on the phone to the police but overall the police were unable to do anything due to lack of evidence.
We did record some of it on the audio recording hardware that Environmental Heath had installedÂ  but they were unable to provide us with the recordings, and with the hardware being at the other side of the flat behind closed doors, it was too quite for them to count it as too loud.

Photos: Click to enlarge.
